Identifiers_begin: NAME:BLM:FAAP100*:FAAP20*:FAAP24*:FANCA:FANCB:FANCC:FANCE:FANCF:FANCG:FANCL:FANCM:HES1 Identifiers_end Maps_Modules_begin: HMC:GENOME_INSTABILITY_AND_MUTATION MAP:cellcycle_dnarepair / MODULE:FANCONI MAP:cellcycle_dnarepair / MODULE:TLS Maps_Modules_end References_begin: The complex has two functions, FANCM and BLM create reverse-fork structure creating four way junction and allowing initiation of repair for FA core complex and the following steps evolving NER and HR proteins. FANCL ubiquitinates FANCD2 that together with FANCI initiates the repair PMID:19622404 FA core complex regulates REV1 and activated TLS PMID:22266823 ce_re156(MAP:cellcycle_dnarepair): MRN complex co-locolises at the FA foci and modulates propagation of ICL repair by Fanconi PMID:15136767, PMID:19622404 RPA is required for the replication fork block and remodeling toward DNA repair: For role of SNM1B in Fanconi and S-phase checkpoint PMID:18469862 ce_re158(MAP:cellcycle_dnarepair): S phase checkpoint controls and induces FANCD2 monoubiquitusation to start Fanconi and HR PMID:12239151 ce_re163(MAP:cellcycle_dnarepair): PMID:19686080 POLH activates D-loop extention PoLN:HEL308* participate in HR and Fanconi. MAP:DNA_REPAIR/MODULE:TLS Trans-lesion bypass is a bypass of DNA damage during DNA replication by low fidelity polymerases. Advancing of the replication folk despite the un-repaired sequence will avoid long-term block of the replication that can result in the cell death. DNA damage can be corrected after the replication by the DNA repair machinery. PMID:22258607 PMID:22918414 PMID:21701511 ======== References ========
